content: Does the survey track where people are coming from (e.g. blog, reddit, twitter, etc.)? That would allow us to know what venues have the most reach.
No - we could have done that through separate links but did not. Missed opportunity.
Too bad the survey tool doesn't track HTTP Referer
I think that would be valuable to capture next year, though I think we should be careful to avoid correlating it with responses.
What is the value if not that correlation?

What is the value if not that correlation?

know what venues have the most reach

Knowing that people on Twitter has more newcomers than Reddit (for example) isn't really actionable, is it?

And knowing which venue is best at most can tell us to tweak the message to suit that medium better, but that's about it, in my eyes.
Ah, you mean with the content of the responses? I was thinking purely the number of responses.
The whole point is absolutely to find out the number of responses (and for that matter the bounce rate at various depths) from various sources.
But I don't want us to have or be tempted to use data like "people from this source answered this way, people from that source answered that way".
